items.title: How to use your phone as a hotspot
items.author: David Nield
items.summary:
- Running a mobile hotspot allows internet access away from home or office, providing more security and potentially better speeds than public Wi-Fi.
- Setup instructions vary by device:
  - **Pixel**: Go to Settings > Network & Internet > Hotspot & tethering to enable and configure.
  - **Samsung Galaxy**: Navigate to Settings > Connections > Mobile Hotspot and Tethering to toggle and check details.
  - **iPhone**: Access Settings > Personal Hotspot to turn on sharing and adjust compatibility.
- Check your mobile plan for hotspot data limits, as most carriers handle this separately from regular data plans.

items.title: ‘Millions’ may have protested Trump and Musk yesterday
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Hundreds of thousands signed up for over 1,300 "Hands Off!" protests against Trump and Musk.
- Activist group MoveOn estimates millions attended, with over 100,000 in Washington, DC alone.
- Protests addressed various issues, including Trump’s trade war and civil rights.
- Over 150 groups participated, including ACLU and labor unions.
- Some outlets estimate attendance in the hundreds of thousands, while organizers claimed over 3 million nationwide.

items.title: Wi-Fi is one of the great backward compatibility success stories
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- The author's home network connects over 60 devices spanning five generations of Wi-Fi.
- Wi-Fi maintains backward compatibility, allowing newer devices to connect with older versions seamlessly.
- The Wi-Fi Alliance, formed in 1999, certifies products for interoperability to ensure compatibility across devices.
- Certification provides assurance that devices will work together, but some companies like Eero opt for internal certification.
- Issues with device connectivity often stem from untested or uncertified devices, not Wi-Fi version discrepancies.
- Support for the 2.4GHz band is crucial, as it is commonly used by older devices and smart home products.
- The ongoing support for backward compatibility is significant for maintaining device functionality over generations.

items.title: Quantum mechanics might have the solution to joystick drift
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- The Nintendo Switch is significantly impacted by joystick drift, affecting various controllers across brands.
- Tunneling magnetoresistance (TMR) is a potential solution, offering advantages over traditional potentiometer-based controllers.
- TMR technology allows for better longevity as it avoids wear and tear found in current joystick designs.
- Unlike Hall effect sensors, TMR sensors have higher sensitivity and lower power consumption, leading to potential improvements in joystick performance.
- Third-party manufacturers are already producing controllers with TMR joysticks, aiming to address the drift issue. 
- Mainstream adoption of TMR technology in major gaming brands could take several years due to cost factors.

items.title: Your House is like a choose-your-own adventure mystery book
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Your House is a visual novel where players interact with the story as if reading a book.
- Players assume the role of Debbie, who explores a mansion filled with secrets and puzzles after receiving a mysterious postcard and key on her birthday.
- The game features a unique interaction style, with bold text indicating actions, and beautiful noir comic-style illustrations.
- Gameplay includes solving puzzles and uncovering secrets by interacting with the environment.
- It has a reading experience aspect, with a narrow aspect ratio mimicking a physical book.
- The game is relatively short, with a playtime of about three hours, and is available on PC, iOS, and Android.

items.title: ‘Hands Off’: Protesters deliver a sweeping message to Trump and Musk at a DC rally
items.author: Lauren Feiner
items.summary:
- Nationwide Hands Off protests attracted millions across 1,300 events, protesting against Trump and Musk.
- The DC rally saw over 100,000 participants, including various lawmakers and organizers.
- Protesters voiced a multitude of concerns, highlighting the need to protect democracy and essential government programs.
- The event remained peaceful with a focus on non-violence amid messages against policy changes under Trump and Musk.
- Organizers facilitated travel to DC protests, with equal turnout reported in cities like New York and even in red states.

items.title: One streaming app to (almost) rule them all
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary:
- Plex has launched a new mobile app that integrates streaming media with personal libraries and is subscription-based at $4.99/month.
- Delta 1.7 is now the best game emulator for iPhone and includes online multiplayer for Nintendo DS games.
- Skylight, resembling TikTok, runs on the AT Protocol and is gaining popularity.
- Microsoft celebrated its 50th anniversary by releasing its original Altair BASIC source code.
- The Nintendo Switch 2 is officially launching in June; more details on specs and game lineup have been released.
- Sofa app has introduced a podcast player and is noted for its ease of use in managing content.

items.title: Color is a mathematical nightmare
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Color is defined through complex mathematical models known as color spaces.
- Different color models (CMYK, RGB, HSL) serve various purposes, impacting color representation in applications like printing and digital displays.
- Gamut refers to the range of colors a device can display, influencing the suitability of monitors for creative tasks.
- Color spaces like sRGB, Adobe RGB, and Rec.709 are optimized for specific applications, ensuring color consistency Across devices.

items.title: Meta AI gets two new models as Meta releases Llama 4
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Meta has announced the release of [Llama 4](https://ai.meta.com/blog/llama-4-multimodal-intelligence/), a new collection of AI models for applications in WhatsApp, Messenger, and Instagram Direct.
- The two models released are Llama 4 Scout, a small model suitable for a single Nvidia H100 GPU, and Llama 4 Maverick, comparable to GPT-4o.
- Llama 4 Scout features a 10-million-token context window and outperforms several competitive models, including Google's Gemini 3.
- Llama 4 Behemoth, currently in training, claims 288 billion active parameters and aims to surpass models like GPT-4.5.
- Meta uses a “mixture of experts” architecture to optimize resources based on task requirements.
- Future developments will be discussed at [LlamaCon on April 29th](https://www.llama.com/llama-downloads/).
- Despite being labeled as “open-source,” the licensing requirements have faced criticism for being restrictive, especially for large commercial users.

items.title: More than 1,200 rallies rally worldwide protest Trump and Musk
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Protests against President Trump and Elon Musk occurred globally, organized by over 150 groups, across more than 1,200 locations.
- Demonstrations included 'Tesla Takedown' protests targeting Tesla showrooms amid Musk's layoffs and declining sales.
- Large crowds gathered in major cities like Washington, DC, Chicago, and overseas in Berlin and London, with significant turnout even in smaller communities.

items.title: Microsoft has created an AI-generated version of Quake
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Microsoft unveiled its Muse AI model which can generate gameplay, now featuring an AI-generated version of **Quake II**.
- The tech demo is playable in a browser but limited in interactions and time.
- This latest demo runs at 640 x 360 resolution and retains a playable frame rate, compared to earlier versions that were significantly lower.
- The AI model is aimed at helping game developers prototype games and improve classic titles like **Quake II** for modern hardware.
- Microsoft Gaming CEO Phil Spencer emphasized the potential of making classic games portable to various platforms using AI models.
- More interactive AI game experiences through Copilot Labs are expected soon, along with enhancements to Copilot as a gameplay coach.

items.title: Tron: Ares blends the real world with the digital in its first trailer
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Disney released the first trailer for **Tron: Ares**, a sequel to **Tron: Legacy**.
- The trailer features visuals of a dark and moody world with signature light trails.
- Jared Leto's character, Ares, is shown fleeing from police on a light cycle.
- A massive airship hovers over a city, while Jeff Bridges reprises his role as Kevin Flynn.
- The film's soundtrack is done by **Nine Inch Nails** and is set to release in theaters on **October 10th**.

items.title: The 7 writing apps I used to start and finish my book
items.author: Kevin Nguyen
items.summary:
- The author, Kevin Nguyen, shares his experiences with different writing apps used throughout his book writing process.
- He uses **Bear** for structured ideas and **Notes** for quick thoughts, emphasizing the importance of having different environments for creative work.
- The primary drafting is done in **iA Writer**, which Nguyen appreciates for its simplicity despite its cost.
- **Google Docs** is utilized for organizing and revising, especially once a significant amount of text is produced.
- Nguyen discusses his choice to use **Scrivener** for its organizational features but prefers to write in Google Docs due to its familiarity.
- Final revisions involve exporting to **Microsoft Word** for editing and proofing before publication, illustrating the necessity of adapting tools for professional standards.

items.title: Jaguar Land Rover pauses US shipments over Trump tariffs
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Jaguar Land Rover (JLR) has announced a pause in shipments to the US for April 2025 due to new tariffs imposed by President Trump.
- The pause is a response to a 25% tariff on imported vehicles that could significantly increase car prices by $5,000 to $10,000.
- Approximately 25% of JLR’s annual sales, totaling 400,000 vehicles, are directed to US buyers, and the company believes it has enough existing stock to last for about two months before resuming shipments.
- Other companies, like Nintendo, are also affected by the tariffs, delaying preorders of the Switch 2.

items.title: The best wireless earbuds to buy right now
items.author: Chris Welch
items.summary:
- The market for wireless earbuds has significantly improved in sound quality and performance.
- Companies like Sony, Apple, and Samsung have released top-rated models with features such as noise cancellation and sound quality.
- Exclusive features (e.g., head-tracking spatial audio) are often tied to specific brands and devices.
- Featured earbuds include:
  - **Sony WF-1000XM5**: Best overall noise cancellation, dynamic sound, comfortable fit. Price: $248.
  - **Nothing Ear (a)**: Budget option with decent ANC and good sound. Price: $79.
  - **Bose QuietComfort Ultra**: Excellent sound and ANC, priced at $299.
  - **Apple AirPods Pro (2nd Gen)**: Improved features over the original with a price of $198.
- Selection criteria for earbuds include sound quality, noise cancellation, battery life, and comfort.

items.title: ‘Views’ are lies
Trump’s tariffs killed his TikTok deal
items.author: Alex Heath
items.summary:
- TikTok's fate in the US was expected to be decided by April 5th, with multiple bids emerging from companies like Amazon and OnlyFans.
- President Trump's tariff war has hindered any potential deal for TikTok, with the White House only seriously considering an Oracle-led consortium.
- The tariff announcement disrupted the approval of a proposal to license TikTok's algorithm from China, affecting negotiations and leaving TikTok's future uncertain.

items.title: DOGE staffers are listed in the FCC directory
items.author: Lauren Feiner
items.summary:
- Elon Musk’s Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) has staff listed in the FCC directory.
- Identified staff include Tarak Makecha, Jordan Wick, and Jacob Altik, associated with the Office of the Chairman.
- Makecha previously worked for Tesla and is involved in a drone detection company; Wick is a former Waymo engineer; Altik is a lawyer.
- DOGE has recently expanded into other enforcement agencies, including the Federal Trade Commission.
- The FCC’s authority intersects with Musk's businesses, particularly SpaceX and Starlink operations.

items.title: Ring’s founder is back at Amazon
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Jamie Siminoff, founder of Ring, has returned to Amazon as vice president after a two-year absence.
- He will be in charge of the Ring, Blink, Amazon Key, and Sidewalk teams, succeeding Liz Hamren.
- Siminoff emphasizes the importance of AI transformation, stating it represents a 'once-in-a-generation opportunity'.
- He aims to enhance customer experiences by integrating devices in a connected manner.
- Following his departure, Siminoff sold his new company Honest Day’s Work to Latch, now known as Door.com.

items.title: We just declared a trade war with the world
items.author: Elizabeth Lopatto
items.summary:
- The Trump administration has announced a set of globally applied tariffs that economists criticize as nonsensical and harmful.
- Experts suggest that the tariffs could lead to significant economic downturns, including a 60% chance of recession.
- The tariffs target a broad range of imports, causing immediate stock market losses of $6.6 trillion and increasing costs for consumers.

items.title: Trump’s TikTok delay is ‘against the law’ top Senate Intelligence Democrat says
items.author: Lauren Feiner
items.summary:
- President Trump announced a 75-day delay on TikTok's sale-or-ban deadline, prompting criticism from Senate Intelligence Committee members.
- Senator Mark Warner described the delay as illegal and a sham if the app’s algorithm remains under Beijing's control.
- House Republicans emphasized the urgency of adhering to U.S. law to prevent Chinese access to American user data.
- Previous bipartisan legislation aimed to address security risks related to TikTok, upheld by the Supreme Court, faced new legal uncertainty due to Trump's actions.
- Democrats in Congress are urging Trump to seek collaboration rather than unilaterally extending deadlines to avoid legal complications for tech companies.

items.title: Car Companies' Responses to Trump's Tariffs: Price Hikes, Layoffs, and Changes in Production
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
* President Trump's 25% tariffs on auto imports disrupt the market, with potential price hikes of $12,000 per vehicle.
* Audi is holding vehicles at US ports; BMW expects a €1 billion earnings hit; GM is increasing truck production in the US.
* Ford launched a pricing program to counteract consumer panic; Stellantis is laying off 900 workers while pausing production.
* Honda is adjusting production to avoid tariffs; Hyundai is investing $21 billion in the US but warns of potential price increases.
* Toyota is not planning immediate price changes; Volkswagen is adding import fees; Volvo is considering increased US production.

items.title: The best robot vacuums
items.author: Jennifer Pattison Tuohy
items.summary:
- Robot vacuums have evolved into intelligent devices, capable of both vacuuming and mopping with limited human intervention.
- Over 70 models have been tested, showcasing diverse options for different household needs, from small apartments to large homes.
- The best overall robot vacuum is the [Roborock S8 MaxV Ultra](https://go.skimresources.com/?id=1025X1701640&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fus.roborock.com%2Fpages%2Froborock-s8-maxv-ultra), priced at $1,799.99, which excels in vacuuming and obstacle detection.
- A budget-friendly option is the [Tapo RV30 Max Plus](https://www.amazon.com/Tapo-Self-Emptying-Max-RV30-Plus/dp/B0DGRJKDKC?tag=theverge02-20), available for around $300, offering solid performance at a lower cost.
- For mopping, the S8 MaxV Ultra features a sonic mopping system that effectively cleans hard floors, with good AI-powered obstacle navigation.

items.title: DOGE staffer ‘Big Balls’ has access to immigration agency’s data
items.author: Gaby Del Valle
items.summary:
- Four DOGE staffers, including Edward Coristine (known as 'Big Balls'), were granted access to USCIS data.
- Access involves a system referred to as USCIS’s “data lake,” functioning as a cloud-based repository for various immigration data.
- The access raises concerns over why DOGE needs this information, as it includes sensitive data on refugees, asylum seekers, and green card holders pursuing citizenship.
- Elon Musk's involvement is noted due to his controversial views on immigration and claims related to undocumented immigrants.

items.title: Meta’s fact-checking program in the US officially ends soon
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Meta’s US fact-checking program will conclude by Monday afternoon.
- No new fact checks or fact checkers will be present on Facebook, Instagram, and Threads.
- The program is being replaced by Community Notes, which allows contributors to provide contextual notes on posts.
- Community Notes was announced in January, aimed to be less biased according to Mark Zuckerberg.
- Testing of Community Notes began on March 18, with a gradual rollout planned across platforms.
- Meta will continue to use third-party fact-checking in other countries and expand Community Notes globally in the future.

items.title: Microsoft CEOs interrupted by another employee protestor: ‘shame on all of you’
items.author: Chris Welch
items.summary:
- During Microsoft’s 50th anniversary event, a protestor disrupted the ceremony, criticizing CEOs Satya Nadella, Steve Ballmer, and Bill Gates over the company’s ties to Israel.
- The protestor shouted, "Shame on you all. You’re all hypocrites," linking Microsoft technology to Palestinian casualties in Gaza.
- This incident follows another protest earlier in the event where an employee labeled the AI CEO a "war profiteer." 
- The protest was part of a larger movement coordinated by the group [No Azure for Apartheid](https://noazureforapartheid.com/) that aims to hold Microsoft accountable for its corporate policies.

items.title: The AI industry doesn’t know if Trump just killed its GPU supply
items.author: Tina Nguyen
items.summary:
- AI companies are uncertain about the impact of Trump’s tariffs on GPUs.
- Nvidia and TSMC stocks dropped by approx 7.5% following tariff news.
- Key question: Are GPUs exempt from tariffs? The answer remains unclear.
- AMD GPUs are primarily imported as servers, facing a potential 32% tariff.
- White House and U.S. Trade Representatives did not clarify the situation.
- Tariffs could significantly affect major tech companies like Amazon, Google, and Microsoft.
- The AI industry may seek favor from Trump, as seen with prior collaborations.
- Nvidia is moving some manufacturing to the U.S. to mitigate tariff impacts.
- Economic ramifications could lead to increased electronics prices if tariffs remain unchanged.
- Tech leaders are expected to meet with Trump to seek clarity and possible exemptions.

items.title: Starlink competition is ramping up in Ukraine
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Eutelsat, with German government support, has been providing internet access to Ukraine for almost a year.
- Eutelsat operates low-orbiting satellites similar to SpaceX’s Starlink, which has approx. 50,000 terminals in Ukraine.
- Eutelsat aims to expand its presence with an additional 5,000 to 10,000 terminals shortly, pending funding discussions.
- Eutelsat is also collaborating with the EU SpaceRISE consortium to create a secure satellite constellation IRIS².
- The U.S.-Ukraine relationship's complexity is increasing, prompting exploration of alternatives to Starlink.

items.title: The Best Deals on MacBooks Right Now
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- Apple has discontinued the M1 MacBook Air, but it is available from some retailers starting at $649, significantly lower than the latest MacBook Pro prices.
- Discounts of up to $400 are common on various MacBook models; refurbished options from Apple offer 15-20% savings.
- Current best deals include:
  - M1 MacBook Air for $649 (Walmart).
  - M2 MacBook Air starting at $749 at Best Buy.
  - M3 MacBook Air starting at $899 at B&H Photo.
  - M4 MacBook Air for $949 at Amazon.

items.title: Trump delays TikTok ban again
items.author: Richard Lawler
items.summary:
- President Trump announced a second 75-day delay to the TikTok ban affecting ByteDance.
- The initial deadline was set to expire, leading Trump to sign an Executive Order to extend it for another 75 days.
- Despite public bids to purchase TikTok, ByteDance remains unwilling to sell or reduce its stake as required by the law.
- Trump has imposed new tariffs on Chinese products, stating he might negotiate terms to lower tariffs for a TikTok deal.
- The decision to extend the delay was made to prevent the app from being shut down again, highlighting the ongoing negotiations with China.

items.title: Microsoft employee disrupts 50th anniversary and calls AI boss ‘war profiteer’
items.author: Tom Warren

items.title: DOGE has arrived at the FTC
items.author: Lauren Feiner
items.summary:
- Two members of Elon Musk’s Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE), Gavin Kliger and Emily Bryant, spotted at the FTC.
- They are now listed in the FTC’s internal directory under the Office of the Chairman.
- DOGE aims to address waste, fraud, and abuse within the FTC, which has fewer than 1,200 employees.
- FTC chair Andrew Ferguson advocates for regulatory agencies to operate under presidential control.
- The FTC possesses sensitive nonpublic information, including material for an upcoming antitrust trial against Meta.
- The agency oversees Musk’s businesses, with X (formerly Twitter) under a consent decree for mishandling user data.

items.title: An immersive version of The Wizard of Oz is coming to the Las Vegas Sphere
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Sphere Entertainment announced new immersive experiences, including an enhanced version of *The Wizard of Oz*.
- Premiere date: August 28, 2025, at Sphere's 160,000 square foot screen.
- Collaboration with Warner Bros. Discovery, Google, and Magnopus, promising to enhance the original film.
- Sphere's screen resolution: 16,000 x 16,000 pixels, offering multi-sensory experiences.
- A new film, *From The Edge*, featuring elite athletes is also planned for 2026.

items.title: US Tariffs: Impact on Big Tech and Consumers
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Nintendo delays preorders for the Switch 2 due to concerns about tariffs.
- China retaliates with matching tariffs on US goods after Trump’s tariff announcements.
- Tariffs are expected to raise prices on gadgets including smartphones and laptops.
- A 54% tariff on goods imported from China affects board game companies, prompting price increases.
- Some companies like PSA are pausing international submissions due to tariff expenses.

items.title: ‘Careless People’ author to testify during a Senate hearing about Facebook
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Sarah Wynn-Williams, ex-Meta employee and author of *Careless People*, will testify before a Senate Judiciary subcommittee next week.
- Senator Josh Hawley stated that the hearing will cover Facebook's cooperation with the Chinese Communist regime and plans to build censorship tools.
- Despite a gag order from Meta, *Careless People* topped the *New York Times* bestseller list upon its release.
- The book includes accounts of Facebook’s strategies to operate in China, involving partnerships and data collection to appease the Communist Party.
- Hawley mentioned the hearing will also discuss alleged plans to share American user data with China.
- There is interest from the EU and UK to speak with Wynn-Williams regarding her insights.

items.title: Here’s how Nintendo Switch 2 preorders will work
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- Nintendo announced the release date for the Switch 2: June 5th, 2025, priced at $449.99.
- Preorders initially scheduled for April 9th, 2025, have been indefinitely delayed due to tariff assessments.
- New preorder date will be released in the future while maintaining the original launch date.
- Switch 2 will feature a 7.9-inch LCD display, support 1080p resolution, 256GB storage, and improved Joy-Cons with new functionality.
- Launch games include **Mario Kart World**, **Split Fiction**, and **Cyberpunk 2077**, with backward compatibility for original Switch games.
- Preorder eligibility includes owning a Nintendo account for at least 12 months and logging specific gameplay hours.

items.title: Microsoft updates Copilot with the greatest hits from other AIs
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- Microsoft is updating Copilot to include new features such as memory, personalization, web actions, podcast creation, and more.
- The Memory feature allows Copilot to remember users' preferences and make tailored suggestions, with an opt-out option.
- Copilot can now perform tasks like booking tickets and searching for products through a new Actions feature.
- Copilot Vision will expand to Windows and mobile, processing what's on-screen or in the camera view.
- Deep Research will help analyze multiple documents for projects, integrating AI responses in Bing.
- Features are rolling out in initial versions and will improve over time; many functionalities already exist in other AI tools.

items.title: Microsoft brings Copilot Vision to Windows and mobile for AI help in the real world
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Microsoft is launching Copilot Vision for Windows and mobile, expanding its use beyond Edge webpages.
- The feature allows real-time video analysis from mobile cameras, providing tips for plant care and home decoration.
- Available today on iOS and Android; Windows support is expected soon.
- The Windows Copilot app will assist with tasks like using Adobe Photoshop or analyzing photos and webpages.
- Copilot Vision is distinct from Copilot Plus's Recall feature, focusing on screen sharing instead.
- Windows Insiders will get access next week, with broader rollout after testing; new features have also been added today.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot can now use the web on your behalf
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Microsoft introduces Copilot’s Actions feature, allowing it to complete online tasks for users.
- Actions can handle bookings, purchases, and more using simple chat prompts.
- Partnership with services like Booking.com, Expedia, and Open Table to enhance travel and dining experiences.
- The feature works with most websites and can manage tasks in the background.
- Initial rollout begins today, with broader availability in the coming weeks and months, positioning Microsoft ahead in automatic task-performing AI.

items.title: FromSoftware’s Miyazaki assures fans the studio will still make single-player games
items.author: Antonio G. Di Benedetto
items.summary:
- Hidetaka Miyazaki reassures fans that FromSoftware will continue developing single-player games amidst plans for multiplayer titles.
- The new game, *The Duskbloods*, is a Switch 2 exclusive featuring vampiric characters with superhuman abilities.
- *Elden Ring Nightreign*, another multiplayer title, is set for release on May 30, while *The Duskbloods* is expected in 2026.

items.title: All of the news from Microsoft’s 50th Anniversary Copilot event
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Microsoft held a 50th Anniversary Copilot livestream on April 4th, showcasing updates to its AI assistant.
- CEO Satya Nadella and leaders from past and present took part in the event.
- Key features announced include Copilot performing online tasks like booking reservations and purchase items for users.
- Microsoft is partnering with several services like Booking.com and Open Table to enhance Copilot’s functionalities.
- The Copilot Vision feature extends the AI's capabilities to analyze real-time video through smartphone cameras.
- Microsoft indicated Copilot would remember user preferences and suggest relevant actions or information.
- Live Captions and Cocreator tools were introduced, enabling real-time audio translations and AI-assisted drawing in Paint.

items.title: Z-Wave is remaking itself to find a new place in your smart home
items.author: Jennifer Pattison Tuohy
items.summary:
- Z-Wave left out of the new Matter standard for smart homes, raising questions about its future.
- Originally conceived in the late 1990s, Z-Wave is now shifting to open-source technology and launching Z-Wave Long Range (ZWLR) to improve device connectivity.
- Z-Wave remains prevalent in home security (40 million homes in the US), but struggles with adoption due to its hub requirement compared to more accessible standards like Wi-Fi.
- ZWLR extends range up to 1.5 miles, alleviating mesh network issues by allowing direct device-to-hub communication.
- Adoption is increasing, with over 100 ZWLR-certified devices on the market, but Z-Wave must find integration with Matter to remain relevant.
- Z-Wave features backward compatibility, supporting both traditional and new ZWLR devices on a hub.
- Industry experts suggest bridging Z-Wave with Matter could ensure its survival and integration into mainstream smart home products.

items.title: Nintendo delays Switch 2 preorders over tariff concerns
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Nintendo has postponed the preorders for the Switch 2, originally set for April 9, 2025, due to concerns over newly announced tariffs.  
- The release date for the console remains unchanged at June 5, 2025.  
- The Switch 2 will retail for $449.99 and features upgrades including a 7.9-inch 1080p display and 256GB of storage.  
- The announcement of the delays follows President Donald Trump’s far-reaching tariffs affecting U.S. trade partners, impacting various industries significantly.

items.title: Philips Hue bulbs and lighting kits are deeply discounted today only
items.author: Cameron Faulkner
items.summary:
- Discounts on a mix of new, open-box, and refurbished Philips Hue products available until April 4.
- Additional 15% off with code **15OFF** at checkout.
- Key products include:
  - Philips Hue Bridge (Gen 2): essential for connecting up to 50 lights, priced at $25.
  - Philips Hue Inara Outdoor Smart Wall Light: IP44-rated, supports E26 bulbs, priced at $42.
  - Philips Hue Smart 60W A19 LED Bulb (2-pack): adjustable color temperature, priced at $31.
  - Philips Hue Play 65 TV Gradient Lightstrip: mimics TV screen activity, requires Hue Bridge and HDMI Sync Box, priced at $127.

items.title: Why I’ve covered Microsoft for 25 years
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Tom Warren reflects on his journey of covering Microsoft for 25 years, starting from his teenage curiosity about Windows.
- He gained fame through his involvement with leaked Windows XP builds and blogging about Microsoft software.
- Over the years, he has reported on significant product launches, including Windows Vista, Windows 8, and Windows 10, while facing legal challenges from Microsoft.
- Warren established his own site, WinRumors, before joining The Verge to pursue tech journalism full-time.
- He discusses the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on tech events and the company's shift towards AI and cloud features in recent years.
- Warren expresses his anticipation for Microsoft's 50th anniversary event and the company's future innovations.

items.title: Here’s the original source code for Microsoft’s very first product
items.author: Jess Weatherbed

items.title: NSA Director Timothy Haugh Fired Following Meeting with Laura Loomer
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- General Timothy Haugh, NSA director, was fired reportedly after Laura Loomer urged President Trump to remove him.
- Wendy Noble, Deputy Director of the NSA, was also fired and may be reassigned at the Pentagon.
- Loomer claimed Haugh's disloyalty to Trump was the reason for his dismissal, highlighting Haugh's selection by General Mark Milley.
- Haugh was nominated by Biden in 2023 and had a lengthy military career before his appointment.
- Democrats criticized the firing, questioning Trump's leadership and decision-making based on Loomer's influence.

items.title: How Microsoft made it through 50 years
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Microsoft was founded in 1975 by Bill Gates and Paul Allen, with a focus on making essential software.
- In 2005, Ray Ozzie warned that advertising-supported services could threaten Microsoft's business model.
- The transition to cloud computing was controversial within Microsoft, but Office was moved to the cloud alongside the launch of Azure in 2010.
- Microsoft has experienced both major successes and failures over its history, including missed opportunities in mobile technology and the launch of Windows 8.
- Under CEO Satya Nadella, Microsoft has aggressively pursued AI, significantly investing in OpenAI since 2019.
- The company's aim is to create personalized software through AI, evolving its services and models to meet new demands.
- Microsoft envisions AI agents working alongside users in various capacities, with ongoing research in robotics and quantum computing.

items.title: Microsoft is now 50 years old
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Microsoft was founded on April 4, 1975, by Bill Gates and Paul Allen.
- The company initially focused on microprocessors and software for the Altair 8800.
- Key milestones include a deal with IBM for MS-DOS in 1980 and the launch of Windows in 1985.
- Windows 95 was launched at midnight with widespread anticipation, featuring key elements still in use today.
- Microsoft Office, introduced in 1989, became a critical productivity suite for users.
- The company expanded with products like Xbox (2001), Azure (2008), and Bing (2009).
- Surface devices launched in 2012 showcase Microsoft's innovations and AI capabilities.
- A 50-year anniversary event is being held at Microsoft's headquarters, featuring new features and reflections on the company's history.
